oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anticonvulsant Therapy in Veterinary Medicine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Parker, Alan J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: anticonvulsants
seizure phenomena
dogs
cats
effectiveness
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: My topic is limited to the use of anticonvulsants in dogs and cats. My experience has been as a clinical trial investigator with certain anticonvulsants and as a clinical neurologist handling problem seizure cases. This has led me to my view that (1) clinical experience with seizure phenomena and anticonvulsants is a valuable tool to suggest subjects worthy of experimental investigation, and (2) clinical experience with seizure cases and anticonvulsants is a misleading tool to use to formulate theories concerning the use and effectiveness of anticonvulsants. My objectives today are to outline my reasons for these views and to discuss what we have recently learned about anticonvulsants.
